titleStmt.author: Hitoshi Moshima

sourceDesc.p: A letter to L.L Horn, by the mayor of Nagasaki

body.p: Thank you very much for your expressions of concern and encouragement. After 35 days of treatment, I was discharge from the hospital on February 21 and returned to work at city hall on March 1.

When shot, I thought my stay in this world was over. The subsequent operation was successful, but I felt for several days that I was treading the fine line between life and death. I am still recovering from the mental and physical shock of the attack -- an event which s hould never have occurred in this city of peace Nagasaki. It is at least a comfort to know that no one e lse was injured.

The greatest encouragement for me was the many cordial messages of sympathy received during the weeks after ~ he incident. It is my firm intention now as mayor of Nagasaki to strive with you for nuclear disarma ment, for world peace , and for genuine d e mocracy in Japan.

The first thing that entered my mind on my hospital bed ,was the suffering of the ill, of the aged and handicapped, of the mentally distressed, and of single mothers. Watching the slow but steady growth of early spring leaves from the window, I realized clearly that we must persevere in the face of various circumstances in life.

The faith passed on from my ancestors helped me to remain calm after the bullet passed through my chest, and to pray quietly to God. I am living now with peace and a feeling of enormous gratitude. Please accept my repeated thanks and my warm wishes for good health and happiness for you and your loved ones.
